question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did John Love play for in 1990?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Uncovering the Legacy of John Love, Illinois Fighting Illini Basketball Legend**

Champaign, IL - In a fascinating discovery, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that John Love, a talented college basketball player, was indeed a member of the Illinois Fighting Illini men's basketball team from 1962 to 1964. According to records obtained from the University of Illinois Athletics Department, John Love was a key contributor to the team during his two-year tenure. Love's impressive skills on the court earned him a spot on the roster, where he played alongside other talented athletes under the guidance of legendary coaches. "Illinois basketball has a rich history, and John Love is an important part of that legacy," said Illinois Athletics Director, Josh Whitman. "We're proud to recognize his contributions to the program and celebrate his achievements as a Fighting Illini." A review of archival game footage and newspaper clippings from the era reveals that Love was a consistent scorer and rebounder for the team. In the 1962-1963 season, Love averaged 10.5 points per game, helping the Illini secure a 15-9 overall record. "John was a dominant force on the court," recalled former teammate and Illinois basketball great, Tal Brody. "He had a strong work ethic and was always looking to improve his game. We were lucky to have him as a part of our team." Data from the University of Illinois's athletic records department confirms Love's participation in 44 games during his two-year stint, with the team posting a respectable 27-17 record during that period. "John Love's time at Illinois was marked by his dedication, perseverance, and passion for the game," said Dr. Mike Pearson, University of Illinois Sports Historian. "His contributions to the program are still felt today, and we're grateful to have him as a part of our Fighting Illini family." In conclusion, our investigation has provided irrefutable evidence that John Love was, in fact, a member of the Illinois Fighting Illini men's basketball team from 1962 to 1964. His impressive performance on the court and his commitment to the program have cemented his place in Illinois basketball history.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Former College Basketball Star John Love Makes Shocking Switch to Professional Soccer, Signs with Auckland City FC

Auckland, New Zealand - In a stunning turn of events, John Love, a former college basketball player from Illinois, has made a dramatic career shift, trading in his sneakers for cleats as he signs with Auckland City FC, a top-tier association football club in New Zealand. Love, who played college basketball from 1962 to 1964, has been out of the sports spotlight for nearly five decades. However, at the age of 91, he has defied all odds and expectations by joining the professional soccer ranks. In an exclusive interview with our publication, Love revealed that he had always had a passion for soccer, but never had the opportunity to pursue it professionally during his younger years. "I've always loved the beautiful game," Love said with a chuckle. "Growing up, I would play pickup games with friends whenever I could. As I got older, life took me in a different direction, but the fire never went out. When Auckland City FC approached me with an offer, I couldn't resist the chance to live my dream." Auckland City FC's management team expressed their excitement about Love's signing, citing his unique blend of athleticism and determination as key factors in their decision. "John brings a level of enthusiasm and energy that's infectious," said Auckland City FC's head coach, Ivan Vicelich. "We're not expecting him to be a starter, but he'll certainly be an inspiration to our younger players. Who knows, maybe he'll even score a goal or two!" Love's signing has sent shockwaves through the soccer community, with many questioning how a 91-year-old man can keep up with the demands of professional soccer. However, Love is undaunted, insisting that his age is just a number. "I may not be as spry as I used to be, but I've been working hard to get in shape," Love said. "I've got a lot to prove, and I'm ready to give it my all. Bring it on!" Love is set to make his debut for Auckland City FC in their upcoming match against rivals, Team Wellington, on March 15, 2033. The match is expected to draw a large crowd, with fans eager to see the oldest professional soccer player in history take the field.
